sourceMeaningMnemonic: A <radical>fish</radical> with two <radical>mouth</radical>s has the number <radical>two</radical> on it because it's in <radical>prison</radical> (that's its prison number). Who put the poor two-mouthed fish in prison? An <kanji>alligator</kanji>. Because alligators hate two-mouthed fish.
meaningInfo: How the alligator wishes it had a second mouth like the fish with two mouths, prisoner number 2! It believes that with another mouth, it would be the most talked-about predator, so it imprisons the two-mouthed fish out of jealousy.
readingMnemonic: The reading is the same as the <ja>わに</ja> in "Wanikani." Ever heard of it?
readingInfo: So long as you've ever used WaniKani, you probably know the reading of the word alligator.
